newsitem.title: USA: IBM 97 EPS, price target raised - Salomon.
newsitem.headline: IBM 97 EPS, price target raised - Salomon.

text.p: Salomon Brothers analyst John Jones increased his 1997 earnings estimates on International Business Machines Corp after its board authorized another share buyback plan that will decrease its shares outstanding.

Jones raised his 1997 earnings estimates to $13.20 a share from $12.80 previously as the average number of shares outstanding at year end 1997 should decrease to 496 million from 528 million at the end of 1996. On Tuesday, IBM's board authorized an additional $3.5 billion share repurchase plan.
Jones also increase his 12-month price target on IBM to $185 per share from $179 currently.

"This repurchase announcement is consistent with recently implemented programs in which IBM spent approximately $1.2 billion per quarter," Jones said in note. "We had expected a continuation of the share buyback program and this announcement should take IBM through the end of third quarter 1997. We expect share repurchases to continue into 1998."
Jones said his preliminary estimate for 1998 is $15.25 and his target price of $185 is equal to 14 times his 1997 earning estimate of $13.20 a share.
He continues to rate IBM a strong buy.
